body:
Hello, dear airbnb team!

I have translated this amazing JavaScript style guide into Persian [here](https://github.com/abolfazlchaman/javascript-style-guide).

I`ve Also translated the awesome React/JSX style guide into Persian [here](https://github.com/abolfazlchaman/javascript-style-guide/tree/master/react).

+added links to Persian in the translation sections of the "JavaScript style guide" & "React/JSX style guide" documents.

title: Documentation for 'import/no-extraneous-dependencies' is missing
body:
The rule is set to error in the config:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/imports.js#L71

But there's no mention of it in the guide:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/README.md

This rule should be mentioned under the Modules section.

title: Added link of JavaScript Roadmap
body:
Hi Jordan,

I came across your repository [javascript](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript) and found it to be a valuable resource for JavaScript enthusiasts.

While browsing through the repository, I noticed that it was missing links to any structured guides such as the famous ["JavaScript Roadmap"](https://roadmap.sh/javascript). I took the initiative to submit a ["Pull Requests"](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/2724) adding it in a separate roadmap section.

Thank you for your time and effort in maintaining this valuable resource :)

Best,
Mouaaz

title: [eslint config] [base] record semver-major default export changes in no-restricted-exports
body:
Records breaking configuration changes to permit `export { default } from` style exports as of eslint 8.33.0.

Flags are as suggested by @ljharb in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/15617#issuecomment-1048278897

See https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/2500 for more context.
**How to use it?**

title: Typo on README.md
body:
In the README.md, section 1.2, there is a typo/mistake in the line:

console.log(foo[0], bar[0]); // => 9, 9

It should display:

console.log(foo[0], bar[0]); // => 1, 9

title: Consider adding `import/no-empty-named-blocks`
body:
Reference: https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/blob/main/docs/rules/no-empty-named-blocks.md

`import/no-empty-named-blocks` was added here: https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2270---2023-01-11

Would it be good addition to the default rules for `airbnb-base`?

title: Revisit standing on Iterators and Generators
body:
So is there any intention to revisit the standing on [Iterators and Generators](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#iterators-and-generators)? I'm mostly instrested specifically in revisiting the advice given in [11.2 Don’t use generators for now.](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#generators--nope) Reason for asking 1. The reasons why are based off thoughts and usage that is more then 7+ years old now 1. Browsers and transpilers have come along way over the last 7+ years 1. With New APIs and Objects
Examples where methods on the objects return an iterator and not an array:
- [Map](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map).[entries()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/entries)
- [Set](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Set).[entries()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Set/entries)

title: import/newline-after-import and `considerComments: true`
body: Would using `considerComments: true` make sense for https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/blob/main/docs/rules/newline-after-import.md?

title: Add a link to Greek translation
body: I created a translation of the guide in Greek and added a link to it. It would be nice to add it.

title: Sentence "Enforce spacing inside of computed property brackets" is confusing
body:
>   - [19.16](#whitespace--computed-property-spacing) Enforce spacing inside of computed property brackets. eslint: [`computed-property-spacing`](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/computed-property-spacing)

When I read this sentence, I thought like this:
```javascript
// bad: freedom spacing (hard to read)
obj[foo ]
obj[ 'foo']
const x = {[ b ]: a}
obj[foo[ bar ]]

// good: forced to spacing inside brackets (easy to read)
obj[ foo ]
obj[ 'foo' ]
const x = { [ b ]: a }
obj[ foo[ bar ] ]
```

But, it was wrong. Correct answer is this:

>   - [19.16](#whitespace--computed-property-spacing) Enforce spacing inside of computed property brackets. eslint: [`computed-property-spacing`](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/computed-property-spacing)
> 
>     ```javascript
>     // bad
>     obj[foo ]
>     obj[ 'foo']
>     const x = {[ b ]: a}
>     obj[foo[ bar ]]
> 
>     // good
>     obj[foo]
>     obj['foo']
>     const x = { [b]: a }
>     obj[foo[bar]]
>     ```

I have some possible solutions:
1. Change the word "enforce" to "avoid".
2. Exclude explaining about spacing in "{}" from sample code.
(already talken in about `eslint: object-curly-spacing` and `eslint: block-spacing`)

or, 

1. Use ESLint official sentence "Enforce **consistent** spacing inside computed property brackets".

Similar Issues and PRs exist already and some have been merged:
- https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/1946
- https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/2127
  - https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/2452

reference: https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/enforce

title: Add Greek translation
body: I would like to contribute by translating the guide in Greek.

title: Question: Why allow empty reject on the `prefer-promise-reject-errors` rule?
body:
Just a question: Why do you allow empty reject on the `prefer-promise-reject-errors` rule?
I've seen no comment or reason 🤔 is it for legacy reason? 🤔 

https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/0d747c6d96f94e54d24d8c005da0c87105bf0fd5/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/best-practices.js#L377-L379

Thanks for any information you can give me regarding best practices.

title: Documentation for 'no-use-before-define' is missing
body:
The rule is set to error in the config:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/1eadb93e377da1e56c3f91f26610e5d0a00738a9/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/variables.js#L54

But there's no mention of it in the guide:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/README.md

This rule should be mentioned under the Variables section.

title: fixed execSync issue in windows #2700
body: #2700 as discussed here, execSync() is opening the file instead of executing the file in windows. Hence appenindg "node " before the file name, to make it work as exepcted.

title: `npm i eslint-config-airbnb-base` results in 4 high severity vulnerabilities
body:
It seems installing eslint-config-airbnb-base includes some vulnerabilities:

```
npm uninstall eslint-config-airbnb-base
```
Output: found 0 vulnerabilities

```
npm install eslint-config-airbnb-base
```
Output: 4 high severity vulnerabilities

title: Remove redundant dependencies
body:
Maybe that's time to drop object.assign and object.entries dependencies? The airbnb config packages are pretty small by itself but these packages are huge: 
- object.assign@4.1.4 (8 deps, 1.25mb, 102 files)
- object.entries@1.1.6 (47 deps, 3.37mb, 1932 files)

I think that's not actual anymore in 2023 since Object.assign was added in node.js v4, Object.entries in v7. 

So, this change could make a typical CI task a bit faster.

There was a closed PR in 2019 https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/2111, I can create a new PR if that makes sense.

title: `Configuration for rule "react/function-component-definition" is invalid`
body: I'm trying to use eslint . I get the above error ⬆️ and it states that: Value ["function-declaration","function-expression"] should be equal to one of the allowed values. I think the only way to solve the issue is to downgrade to a previous version. Here's my package.json in the root folder: `{ "name": "fakebook", "version": "1.0.0", "description": "A fullstack application designed to mimic facebook in a fake and fun way", "main": "index.js", "scripts": { "start": "node server/server.js", "dev": "nodemon server/server.js", "lint": "eslint .", "lint:fix": "eslint . --fix" }, "repository": { "type": "git", "url": "git+https://github.com/TheInfamousGrim/Fakebook.git" }, "author": "George Fincher", "license": "ISC", "bugs": { "url": "https://github.com/TheInfamousGrim/Fakebook/issues" }, "homepage": "https://github.com/TheInfamousGrim/Fakebook#readme", "devDependencies": { "eslint": "^8.2.0", "eslint-config-airbnb": "^18.0.4", "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.25.3", "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "^6.5.1", "eslint-plugin-react": "^7.28.0", "eslint-plugin-react-hooks": "^4.3.0" } }` here's a picture of my client server architecture

title: [guide] Add `Object.hasOwn`
body:
Hello,

18.2 Use // for single line comments. Place single line comments on a newline above the subject of the comment. Put an empty line before the comment unless it’s on the first line of a block.
18.1 Use /** ... */ for multiline comments.

For hasOwn;
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/hasOwn

title: Failed to load config "airbnb" to extend from. remote: Referenced from: /tmp/build_b7392388/client/.eslintrc.json
body:
I get this error when I try to deploy to Heroku :

```
[eslint] Failed to load config "airbnb" to extend from.
remote: Referenced from: /tmp/build_b7392388/client/.eslintrc.json
```

I have a client-server architecture that looks like this: 
![clientserver](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8443316/201495095-9b0510b3-9843-4eba-bcd2-aca3e2c1ca36.png)

And in detail it looks like this:

![clientserverdetails](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8443316/201495116-5a8571ba-69bc-4661-88fb-41dc5b38dd4c.png)

Client part contains .eslintrc.json but the server part (root folder) does not.

Here is package.json from server (root folder):

```
{
      "proxy": "http://localhost:3001",
      "name": "emoteco_nodejs",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "description": "",
      "main": "index.js",
      "homepage": ".",
      "scripts": {
        "start": "node server/index.js",
        "build": "cd client && npm install && npm run build",
        "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"
      },
      "engines": {
        "node": "14.17.5"
      },
      "keywords": [],
      "author": "",
      "license": "ISC",
      "dependencies": {
        "applicationinsights": "^2.3.0",
        "axios": "^0.27.2",
        "azure-storage": "^2.10.7",
        "express": "^4.17.2",
        "gm": "^1.23.1",
        "image-data-uri": "^2.0.1",
        "jsonwebtoken": "^8.5.1",
        "mongodb": "^4.2.2",
        "multer": "^1.4.5-lts.1",
        "node-cron": "^3.0.0",
        "node-html-to-image": "^3.2.4",
        "nodemailer": "^6.7.7",
        "react-validation": "^3.0.7",
        "validator": "^13.7.0"
      },
      "devDependencies": {
        "sass": "^1.52.1"
      }
    }
```


Here is package.json from client (sub folder):

```
{
      "name": "emotecoapp",
      "version": "2.0.1",
      "private": true,
      "author": "Creative Tim",
      "license": "See license in https://www.creative-tim.com/license",
      "description": "Otis Kit PRO by Creative Tim",
      "homepage": "",
      "bugs": {
        "url": "https://github.com/creativetimofficial/ct-otis-kit-pro/issues"
      },
      "repository": {
        "type": "git",
        "url": "git+https://github.com/creativetimofficial/ct-otis-kit-pro.git"
      },
      "engines": {
        "node": "14 || 15 || 16",
        "npm": ">=6"
      },
      "dependencies": {
        "@emotion/cache": "11.7.1",
        "@emotion/react": "11.9.0",
        "@emotion/styled": "11.8.1",
        "@mui/icons-material": "5.6.2",
        "@mui/material": "5.6.4",
        "@mui/styled-engine": "5.6.1",
        "@testing-library/jest-dom": "5.16.4",
        "@testing-library/react": "13.2.0",
        "@testing-library/user-event": "14.1.1",
        "@types/jest": "^29.2.0",
        "@types/node": "^18.11.7",
        "@types/react": "^18.0.24",
        "@types/react-dom": "^18.0.8",
        "axios": "^1.1.3",
        "chroma-js": "2.4.2",
        "flatpickr": "4.6.13",
        "onnxjs": "^0.1.8",
        "prop-types": "15.8.1",
        "react": "18.1.0",
        "react-copy-to-clipboard": "5.1.0",
        "react-countup": "6.2.0",
        "react-dom": "18.1.0",
        "react-flatpickr": "3.10.11",
        "react-native-pytorch-core": "^0.2.2",
        "react-router-dom": "6.3.0",
        "react-scripts": "5.0.1",
        "react-syntax-highlighter": "15.5.0",
        "react-webcam": "^7.0.1",
        "rellax": "1.12.1",
        "swiper": "7.3.4",
        "typed.js": "2.0.12",
        "typescript": "^4.8.4",
        "uuid": "8.3.2",
        "web-vitals": "2.1.4"
      },
      "scripts": {
        "start": "react-scripts start",
        "build": "react-scripts build",
        "test": "react-scripts test",
        "eject": "react-scripts eject",
        "install:clean": "rm -rf node_modules/ && rm -rf package-lock.json && npm install && npm start"
      },
      "browserslist": {
        "production": [
          ">0.2%",
          "not dead",
          "not op_mini all"
        ],
        "development": [
          "last 1 chrome version",
          "last 1 firefox version",
          "last 1 safari version"
        ]
      },
      "devDependencies": {
        "eslint": "^8.2.0",
        "eslint-config-airbnb": "19.0.4",
        "eslint-config-airbnb-base": "^15.0.0",
        "eslint-config-prettier": "8.5.0",
        "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.25.2",
        "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "6.5.1",
        "eslint-plugin-prettier": "4.0.0",
        "eslint-plugin-react": "7.29.4",
        "eslint-plugin-react-hooks": "4.5.0",
        "prettier": "2.6.2"
      }
    }
```

I have tried several solutions like (installation at the root level): 

1.
npm install -g install-peerdeps  

install-peerdeps --dev eslint-config-airbnb

install-peerdeps --dev eslint-config-airbnb-base

It didn't work. 

2. 
I also tried to change the setting.json of the VScode workspace like this:


```
    {
        "eslint.workingDirectories": [
            "./client"
          ]
    }
```

It didn't work as well.

I have tried most of suggested solutions on internet but nothing works on my case.

Do you have any idea how I can solve this issue?

body:
The rule is set to error in the config:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/imports.js#L71

But there's no mention of it in the guide:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/README.md

This rule should be mentioned under the Modules section.

title: Added link of JavaScript Roadmap
body:
Hi Jordan,

I came across your repository [javascript](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript) and found it to be a valuable resource for JavaScript enthusiasts.

While browsing through the repository, I noticed that it was missing links to any structured guides such as the famous ["JavaScript Roadmap"](https://roadmap.sh/javascript). I took the initiative to submit a ["Pull Requests"](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/2724) adding it in a separate roadmap section.

Thank you for your time and effort in maintaining this valuable resource :)

Best,
Mouaaz

title: [eslint config] [base] record semver-major default export changes in no-restricted-exports
body:
Records breaking configuration changes to permit `export { default } from` style exports as of eslint 8.33.0.

Flags are as suggested by @ljharb in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/15617#issuecomment-1048278897

See https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/2500 for more context.
**How to use it?**

title: Typo on README.md
body:
In the README.md, section 1.2, there is a typo/mistake in the line:

console.log(foo[0], bar[0]); // => 9, 9

It should display:

console.log(foo[0], bar[0]); // => 1, 9

title: Consider adding `import/no-empty-named-blocks`
body:
Reference: https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/blob/main/docs/rules/no-empty-named-blocks.md

`import/no-empty-named-blocks` was added here: https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2270---2023-01-11

Would it be good addition to the default rules for `airbnb-base`?

title: Revisit standing on Iterators and Generators
body:
So is there any intention to revisit the standing on [Iterators and Generators](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#iterators-and-generators)? I'm mostly instrested specifically in revisiting the advice given in [11.2 Don’t use generators for now.](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#generators--nope) Reason for asking 1. The reasons why are based off thoughts and usage that is more then 7+ years old now 1. Browsers and transpilers have come along way over the last 7+ years 1. With New APIs and Objects
Examples where methods on the objects return an iterator and not an array:
- [Map](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map).[entries()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/entries)
- [Set](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Set).[entries()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Set/entries)

title: import/newline-after-import and `considerComments: true`
body: Would using `considerComments: true` make sense for https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/blob/main/docs/rules/newline-after-import.md?

title: Add a link to Greek translation
body: I created a translation of the guide in Greek and added a link to it. It would be nice to add it.

title: Sentence "Enforce spacing inside of computed property brackets" is confusing
body:
>   - [19.16](#whitespace--computed-property-spacing) Enforce spacing inside of computed property brackets. eslint: [`computed-property-spacing`](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/computed-property-spacing)

When I read this sentence, I thought like this:
```javascript
// bad: freedom spacing (hard to read)
obj[foo ]
obj[ 'foo']
const x = {[ b ]: a}
obj[foo[ bar ]]

// good: forced to spacing inside brackets (easy to read)
obj[ foo ]
obj[ 'foo' ]
const x = { [ b ]: a }
obj[ foo[ bar ] ]
```

But, it was wrong. Correct answer is this:

>   - [19.16](#whitespace--computed-property-spacing) Enforce spacing inside of computed property brackets. eslint: [`computed-property-spacing`](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/computed-property-spacing)
> 
>     ```javascript
>     // bad
>     obj[foo ]
>     obj[ 'foo']
>     const x = {[ b ]: a}
>     obj[foo[ bar ]]
> 
>     // good
>     obj[foo]
>     obj['foo']
>     const x = { [b]: a }
>     obj[foo[bar]]
>     ```

I have some possible solutions:
1. Change the word "enforce" to "avoid".
2. Exclude explaining about spacing in "{}" from sample code.
(already talken in about `eslint: object-curly-spacing` and `eslint: block-spacing`)

or, 

1. Use ESLint official sentence "Enforce **consistent** spacing inside computed property brackets".

Similar Issues and PRs exist already and some have been merged:
- https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/1946
- https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/2127
  - https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/2452

reference: https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/enforce

title: Add Greek translation
body: I would like to contribute by translating the guide in Greek.

title: Question: Why allow empty reject on the `prefer-promise-reject-errors` rule?
body:
Just a question: Why do you allow empty reject on the `prefer-promise-reject-errors` rule?
I've seen no comment or reason 🤔 is it for legacy reason? 🤔 

https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/0d747c6d96f94e54d24d8c005da0c87105bf0fd5/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/best-practices.js#L377-L379

Thanks for any information you can give me regarding best practices.

title: Documentation for 'no-use-before-define' is missing
body:
The rule is set to error in the config:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/1eadb93e377da1e56c3f91f26610e5d0a00738a9/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/variables.js#L54

But there's no mention of it in the guide:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/README.md

This rule should be mentioned under the Variables section.

title: fixed execSync issue in windows #2700
body: #2700 as discussed here, execSync() is opening the file instead of executing the file in windows. Hence appenindg "node " before the file name, to make it work as exepcted.

title: `npm i eslint-config-airbnb-base` results in 4 high severity vulnerabilities
body:
It seems installing eslint-config-airbnb-base includes some vulnerabilities:

```
npm uninstall eslint-config-airbnb-base
```
Output: found 0 vulnerabilities

```
npm install eslint-config-airbnb-base
```
Output: 4 high severity vulnerabilities

title: Remove redundant dependencies
body:
Maybe that's time to drop object.assign and object.entries dependencies? The airbnb config packages are pretty small by itself but these packages are huge: 
- object.assign@4.1.4 (8 deps, 1.25mb, 102 files)
- object.entries@1.1.6 (47 deps, 3.37mb, 1932 files)

I think that's not actual anymore in 2023 since Object.assign was added in node.js v4, Object.entries in v7. 

So, this change could make a typical CI task a bit faster.

There was a closed PR in 2019 https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/pull/2111, I can create a new PR if that makes sense.

Here's my package.json in the root folder: `{ "name": "fakebook", "version": "1.0.0", "description": "A fullstack application designed to mimic facebook in a fake and fun way", "main": "index.js", "scripts": { "start": "node server/server.js", "dev": "nodemon server/server.js", "lint": "eslint .", "lint:fix": "eslint . --fix" }, "repository": { "type": "git", "url": "git+https://github.com/TheInfamousGrim/Fakebook.git" }, "author": "George Fincher", "license": "ISC", "bugs": { "url": "https://github.com/TheInfamousGrim/Fakebook/issues" }, "homepage": "https://github.com/TheInfamousGrim/Fakebook#readme", "devDependencies": { "eslint": "^8.2.0", "eslint-config-airbnb": "^18.0.4", "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.25.3", "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "^6.5.1", "eslint-plugin-react": "^7.28.0", "eslint-plugin-react-hooks": "^4.3.0" } }` here's a picture of my client server architecture

18.2 Use // for single line comments. Place single line comments on a newline above the subject of the comment. Put an empty line before the comment unless it’s on the first line of a block.
18.1 Use /** ... */ for multiline comments.

For hasOwn;

title: Failed to load config "airbnb" to extend from. remote: Referenced from: /tmp/build_b7392388/client/.eslintrc.json
body:
I get this error when I try to deploy to Heroku :

```
[eslint] Failed to load config "airbnb" to extend from.
remote: Referenced from: /tmp/build_b7392388/client/.eslintrc.json
```

I have a client-server architecture that looks like this: 
![clientserver](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8443316/201495095-9b0510b3-9843-4eba-bcd2-aca3e2c1ca36.png)

And in detail it looks like this:

![clientserverdetails](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8443316/201495116-5a8571ba-69bc-4661-88fb-41dc5b38dd4c.png)

Client part contains .eslintrc.json but the server part (root folder) does not.

Here is package.json from server (root folder):

```
{
      "proxy": "http://localhost:3001",
      "name": "emoteco_nodejs",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "description": "",
      "main": "index.js",
      "homepage": ".",
      "scripts": {
        "start": "node server/index.js",
        "build": "cd client && npm install && npm run build",
        "test": "echo \"Error: no test specified\" && exit 1"
      },
      "engines": {
        "node": "14.17.5"
      },
      "keywords": [],
      "author": "",
      "license": "ISC",
      "dependencies": {
        "applicationinsights": "^2.3.0",
        "axios": "^0.27.2",
        "azure-storage": "^2.10.7",
        "express": "^4.17.2",
        "gm": "^1.23.1",
        "image-data-uri": "^2.0.1",
        "jsonwebtoken": "^8.5.1",
        "mongodb": "^4.2.2",
        "multer": "^1.4.5-lts.1",
        "node-cron": "^3.0.0",
        "node-html-to-image": "^3.2.4",
        "nodemailer": "^6.7.7",
        "react-validation": "^3.0.7",
        "validator": "^13.7.0"
      },
      "devDependencies": {
        "sass": "^1.52.1"
      }
    }
```


Here is package.json from client (sub folder):

```
{
      "name": "emotecoapp",
      "version": "2.0.1",
      "private": true,
      "author": "Creative Tim",
      "license": "See license in https://www.creative-tim.com/license",
      "description": "Otis Kit PRO by Creative Tim",
      "homepage": "",
      "bugs": {
        "url": "https://github.com/creativetimofficial/ct-otis-kit-pro/issues"
      },
      "repository": {
        "type": "git",
        "url": "git+https://github.com/creativetimofficial/ct-otis-kit-pro.git"
      },
      "engines": {
        "node": "14 || 15 || 16",
        "npm": ">=6"
      },
      "dependencies": {
        "@emotion/cache": "11.7.1",
        "@emotion/react": "11.9.0",
        "@emotion/styled": "11.8.1",
        "@mui/icons-material": "5.6.2",
        "@mui/material": "5.6.4",
        "@mui/styled-engine": "5.6.1",
        "@testing-library/jest-dom": "5.16.4",
        "@testing-library/react": "13.2.0",
        "@testing-library/user-event": "14.1.1",
        "@types/jest": "^29.2.0",
        "@types/node": "^18.11.7",
        "@types/react": "^18.0.24",
        "@types/react-dom": "^18.0.8",
        "axios": "^1.1.3",
        "chroma-js": "2.4.2",
        "flatpickr": "4.6.13",
        "onnxjs": "^0.1.8",
        "prop-types": "15.8.1",
        "react": "18.1.0",
        "react-copy-to-clipboard": "5.1.0",
        "react-countup": "6.2.0",
        "react-dom": "18.1.0",
        "react-flatpickr": "3.10.11",
        "react-native-pytorch-core": "^0.2.2",
        "react-router-dom": "6.3.0",
        "react-scripts": "5.0.1",
        "react-syntax-highlighter": "15.5.0",
        "react-webcam": "^7.0.1",
        "rellax": "1.12.1",
        "swiper": "7.3.4",
        "typed.js": "2.0.12",
        "typescript": "^4.8.4",
        "uuid": "8.3.2",
        "web-vitals": "2.1.4"
      },
      "scripts": {
        "start": "react-scripts start",
        "build": "react-scripts build",
        "test": "react-scripts test",
        "eject": "react-scripts eject",
        "install:clean": "rm -rf node_modules/ && rm -rf package-lock.json && npm install && npm start"
      },
      "browserslist": {
        "production": [
          ">0.2%",
          "not dead",
          "not op_mini all"
        ],
        "development": [
          "last 1 chrome version",
          "last 1 firefox version",
          "last 1 safari version"
        ]
      },
      "devDependencies": {
        "eslint": "^8.2.0",
        "eslint-config-airbnb": "19.0.4",
        "eslint-config-airbnb-base": "^15.0.0",
        "eslint-config-prettier": "8.5.0",
        "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.25.2",
        "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "6.5.1",
        "eslint-plugin-prettier": "4.0.0",
        "eslint-plugin-react": "7.29.4",
        "eslint-plugin-react-hooks": "4.5.0",
        "prettier": "2.6.2"
      }
    }
```

I have tried several solutions like (installation at the root level): 

1.
npm install -g install-peerdeps  

install-peerdeps --dev eslint-config-airbnb

install-peerdeps --dev eslint-config-airbnb-base

It didn't work. 

2. 
I also tried to change the setting.json of the VScode workspace like this:


```
    {
        "eslint.workingDirectories": [
            "./client"
          ]
    }
```

It didn't work as well.

I have tried most of suggested solutions on internet but nothing works on my case.

Do you have any idea how I can solve this issue?
